intro: Tritomopterys hexandra, commonly known as the purple leaf tree, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often purple-tinged on the underside, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters. Tritomopterys hexandra is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and floral display. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a versatile addition to gardens in warm climates.
